pages.title: Leo's Big Morning
pages.text: Leo the Lion woke up as the sun rose over the jungle, stretching his paws and letting out a big yawn. 'Today is going to be an adventure!' he said.
pages.parentPrompt: What kind of adventure do you think Leo is planning?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to roar and stretch like Leo starting his day.

pages.title: Meeting Ella and Ziggy
pages.text: As Leo walked through the jungle, he met his friends Ella the Elephant and Ziggy the Zebra. They were excited to join him on his adventure!
pages.parentPrompt: How do you think Ella and Ziggy will help Leo?
pages.improvPrompt: Let your child pretend to stomp like Ella or gallop like Ziggy.

pages.title: The Mysterious Path
pages.text: They soon came across a winding path they'd never seen before. 'Let's see where it goes!' said Leo, leading the way.
pages.parentPrompt: Where do you think the path will lead them?
pages.improvPrompt: Make up what the path might look like, or pretend to walk down it together.

pages.title: Finding the Waterfall
pages.text: At the end of the path, they found a beautiful waterfall surrounded by flowers. It was the perfect spot to rest and enjoy their adventure.
pages.parentPrompt: What would you do if you found a hidden waterfall?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to splash in the water and listen to the sound of the waterfall.

pages.title: Lila's Colorful Quest
pages.text: Lila the Unicorn noticed that the rainbow was missing after a big storm. She decided to find it and bring back the colors.
pages.parentPrompt: Where do you think the rainbow could be hiding?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to imagine what colors Lila might see on her journey.

pages.title: Asking the Birds
pages.text: Lila asked the birds if they'd seen the rainbow. They chirped, 'We saw it flying over the mountains!'
pages.parentPrompt: How do you think the birds can help Lila find the rainbow?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to fly like birds with your child and search together.

pages.title: The Mountain Climb
pages.text: Lila climbed the mountain, hoping to catch a glimpse of the rainbow from the top.
pages.parentPrompt: What do you think Lila will see at the top of the mountain?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to climb together, reaching high as you go.

pages.title: Rainbow Found!
pages.text: At last, Lila spotted the rainbow! It was shining brightly over a hidden valley, and she knew her journey was worth it.
pages.parentPrompt: What do you think Lila learned from her adventure?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to make the rainbow shape with their arms.

pages.title: Benny's Forest Adventure
pages.text: One bright morning, Benny the Bunny decided to explore the forest, ready for his big adventure!
pages.parentPrompt: What do you think Benny might find in the forest?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to hop like Benny as he explores the forest.

pages.title: The Mysterious Rustling
pages.text: Benny heard a rustling sound behind a bush and hopped over to investigate.
pages.parentPrompt: What do you think is making the noise?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to be as curious as Benny and tiptoe to see what's there!

pages.title: Finding New Friends
pages.text: Benny met Tilly the Turtle and Ricky the Raccoon hiding behind the bush.
pages.parentPrompt: What kind of games could Benny play with his new friends?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to make up a game Benny and his friends could play.

pages.title: Homeward Bound
pages.text: After a fun day, Benny hopped home happily, promising to see his friends again soon.
pages.parentPrompt: How does it feel to make new friends?
pages.improvPrompt: Have your child imagine saying goodbye to Benny's friends.

pages.title: Discovering the Paintbrush
pages.text: Mia found an old paintbrush in her attic. When she painted with it, the pictures came to life!
pages.parentPrompt: What would you paint if you had a magic paintbrush?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to paint something magical with your child.

pages.title: Painting a Garden
pages.text: Mia painted a beautiful garden, and suddenly, flowers began to bloom all around her!
pages.parentPrompt: What flowers would you want to see in a magic garden?
pages.improvPrompt: Imagine the scent and colors of the flowers together.

pages.title: An Unexpected Visitor
pages.text: Out of the flowers jumped a little frog who could talk. 'Thank you for creating my home!' he said.
pages.parentPrompt: What do you think the frog wants to say to Mia?
pages.improvPrompt: Make up a conversation with the frog together.

pages.title: Painting the Sky
pages.text: Mia painted a sunset, and the sky above her turned into a beautiful array of colors.
pages.parentPrompt: What colors would you paint in the sky?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to pretend to paint a beautiful sky with their hands.

pages.title: Captain Polly's Treasure
pages.text: Captain Polly the pirate had found a treasure chest, but instead of keeping it, she decided to share it with others in need.
pages.parentPrompt: Why do you think Captain Polly wanted to share her treasure?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child what they would share if they had treasure.

pages.title: Meeting the Villagers
pages.text: Polly sailed to a nearby village and opened her treasure chest for the villagers, who were so happy to receive her gifts!
pages.parentPrompt: What kinds of things do you think Polly shared?
pages.improvPrompt: Pretend to give out treasures together with your child.

pages.title: The Stormy Sea
pages.text: On her way home, Polly faced a big storm! She bravely steered her ship through the wild waves.
pages.parentPrompt: How do you think Polly felt during the storm?
pages.improvPrompt: Make wave motions and pretend to steer a ship together.

pages.title: Home with a Happy Heart
pages.text: Polly returned home safely, feeling happy and proud that she could share her treasure and help others.
pages.parentPrompt: How do you feel when you help others?
pages.improvPrompt: Ask your child to think of one thing they could share with someone.
